The Java IP server

 

Using the Java IP server

The Java IP server is helpful when you don't know the other user's IP address. It works kind of like ICQ, where you can connect to you favorite friend. Here's how it works:

  • First thing you want to do is go online (connect to the Java server). To do so, simply select the "Go online" from the Action menu, or click on the "Go online" button on the toolbar.
  • When you're online, the red light in the status bar will turn green.
  • In the connection view, you can now call other users by the "Using personal information" mode. You can either type the desired user's name and email, or simply select it from the menu below. That menu contains you're bookmarks.

 

Installing the Java IP server

If you want to install the Whisper Java Server you must follow these steps :

You must get JRE (Java Runtime Environnement) from Sun microsystems

From the command prompt of JRE, type:

java ServerIPAddress

The default command (as above) is similar to :

java -DTIMEOUT=60000 -DPORT=3030 -DCONNECTION=256 ServerIPAddress

You can costomize the command for your own needs :

DTIMEOUT This set the time that the server will wait when connected to an idle connection without response
DPORT This tell the server the port to wait on
DCONNECTION This tell Whisper Java Server the number of connections to accept in a simultanous way
